overview_of_class: This is the second of a two-quarter course on quantum theory. We will discuss both the meaning of the theory, and how to calculate experimentally observable quantities with it for simple systems such as atoms, spins, light polarization, and tunneling systems.
name: Quantum Mechanics
title: WCAS PHYSICS 339-2-20 Quantum Mechanics

instructors.instructor_addr: Technological Institute (2145 Sheridan Road), Room F-325, Evanston

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is the second of a two-quarter course on quantum theory. We will discuss both the meaning of the theory, and how to calculate experimentally observable quantities with it for simple systems such as atoms, spins, light polarization, and tunneling systems.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisites: second-year standing in ISP or PHYSICS 330-1 and 333-1. Some familiarity with numerical calculations.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Develop more quantum mechanical concepts: symmetry and conservation laws, angular momentum, Schrodinger's equation for spatial dependence of amplitudes. Apply concepts to Rabi oscillations, tunneling, harmonic oscillator, Hydrogen atom, Bell's theorem, and quantum computing.
